item.title: [PI] Adding Color/Icon
item.dc:creator: @quamari1 quamari1
item.description:
@quamari1 wrote:

[quote=“ImNoHacker, post:2, topic:399293”]Ussually the color codes are
@red@ @bla@ @gre@ @yel@ @cya@
and so on…

Each one is the first three letters of the color name, starting with and followed by a @ symbol…

So it would be, white for mod… meh…
if (c.playerRights == 1) {
rank = “[@whi@Moderator@bla@] [”+ c.playerName +"] : ";
}

But then again… im not to sure when it comes to pi… so yea…[/quote]
Yes this worked, but how would i add the staff icon?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Adding Color/Icon
item.dc:creator: @quamari1 quamari1
item.description:
@quamari1 wrote:

Well I’m a completely noob to java, and i was wondering how can i add colors or staff icons to my yell command. Would be well appreciated :D.

[code]if(c.playerRights >= 0) {
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“yell”)) {
String rank = “”;
String Message = playerCommand.substring(4);

                    if (c.playerRights == 1) {
                            rank = "[Moderator] ["+ c.playerName +"] : ";
                    }
                    if (c.playerRights == 2) {
                            rank = "[Admin] ["+ c.playerName +"] : ";
                    }
                    if (c.playerRights == 3) {
                            rank = "[Owner] ["+ c.playerName +"] : ";
                    }
                    if (c.playerRights == 4) {
                            rank = "[Staff Member] ["+ c.playerName +"] : ";
                    }
                    for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
                            if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
                                    Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
                                    c2.sendMessage(rank+Message);
                            }
                    }
            }[/code]

Read full topic
